components.component: Quill: The Superior Book Plugin
Table of Contents
Quill Guidebook

click.value: <book id="first_book" title="My First Book" author="YourNameHere"> <content>Hello, world!</content> </book>

<book id="first_book" title="Self contained book" author="BananaPuncher714"> <content>Hello, <insert id="name_component"/>!</content> <components> <component id="name_component">BananaPuncher714</component> </components> </book>

<book id="book_a" title="Book A" author="BananaPuncher714"> <content>Fetched component: <insert id="book_b:shared_component"/></content> <inludes> <include type="book">book_b</include> </inludes> </book>

<book id="book_b" title="Book B" author="BananaPuncher714"> <content>Sharing components</content> <components> <component id="shared_component">A component from book B</component> </components> </book>

<book id="styling" title="Styled Book" author="BananaPuncher714"> <content>Example text: <insert id="styled_component"/></content> <components> <component id="styled_component" styles="red_underline bold">Red, underlined and bold</component> </components> <styles> <style id="red_underline"> <formatting> <format type="color">0xFF0000</format> <format type="underline">true</format> </formatting> </style> <style id="bold"> <formatting> <format type="bold">true</format> </formatting> </style> </styles> </book>
<book id="styling2" title="Include stylesheet" author="BananaPuncher714"> <content style="h1">H1 style</content> <inludes> <include type="stylesheet">example_stylesheet</include> </inludes> </book>

<book id="header_and_footer" title="Showcasing headers and footers" author="BananaPuncher714"> <content footer="custom_footer">Book content</content> <components> <component id="header">This goes at the top of the book</component> <component id="custom_footer">This is always at the bottom</component> </components> </book>

Formatted div element:
Blue text

Click me to go to the last page!



Click me to return to the first page!

<click action="COPY_TO_CLIPBOARD" value="<click action="OPEN_URL" value="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ"><color v="0x0b753e">opens a youtube link</color></click>"><color v="0x0b753e">copies the previous element's code</color></click>

br

<
br

br

br

"end"
/>

to=

>

</
go
>

content
>

book

>

Like other elements, hover elements follow the same format, except they require another component as an argument.
<
hover
component=
"some_component"
>
Text that shows the component upon hover
</
hover
>
Information about Quill
Learn how to create your first book
Creating reusable parts for building your book
Store components in separate files
Include components from other books and sources
Make your text look fancy
Store styles in separate files
Give your book a custom header and footer
Make styling your book easier
Stop manually adding newlines for a new page
Learn how to create and visit bookmarks
Give your users something to click
Put more information on the page
Advanced bookbinder techniques
Easier inline styling
Move text like magic
Almost every server has this, right!?
Even ##easier## styling?!
What's this? A Mine in Abyss special? :thinking:
Click to return to the Table of Contents

<
direc
command=
"nofooter"
/>
This directive removes the footer starting with the next page.

<
direc
command=
"nofooter"
/>
This directive removes the header starting with the next page.

<
direc
command=
"footer"
value=
"footer_component"
/>
This directive sets the footer starting with the next page. It requires a valid component id. If using an external component from file, then it must be included by the book.

<
direc
command=
"header"
value=
"header_component"
/>
This directive sets the header starting with the next page. It requires a valid component id. If using an external component from file, then it must be included by the book.

You can use these elements:
<bold
>bold text
</bold
>
<b
>bold text
</b
> regular text
<bold
/>bold text regular text
<b
/>bold text bold text
<unbold
/>regular text bold text
<ub
/>regular text

You can use these elements:
<italic
>italic text
</italic
>
<i
>italic text
</i
> regular text
<italic
/>italic text regular text
<i
/>italic text italic text
<unitalic
/>regular text italic text
<ui
/>regular text

You can use these elements:
<magic
>magic text
</magic
>
<m
>magic text
</m
> regular text
<magic
/>magic text regular text
<m
/>magic text magic text
<unmagic
/>regular text magic text
<um
/>regular text

<strikethrough

</strikethrough
>
<s

</s

<s
/>strikethrough text strikethrough text
<unstrikethrough
/>regular text strikethrough text
<us
/>regular text

<underline

</underline

<u

<underline
/>underlined text regular text
<u
/>underlined text underlined text
<derline
/>regular text underlined text
<n
/>regular text

<reset
/>regular text formatted text
<r
/>regular text
